title: Falcons RB Devonta Freeman ejected for punching Rams' Aaron Donald, igniting skirmish
text:
CLOSE Check out some early NFL headlines. USA TODAY

ATLANTA — It has been an admittedly frustrating season for the Atlanta Falcons, so it’s no surprise that running back Devonta Freeman wanted to punch someone in the midst of another poor performance Sunday against the Los Angeles Rams.

Of course, when the person you’re trying to punch is 6-foot-1, 280-pound defensive tackle Aaron Donald, turning the other cheek might have been a smarter move.

Freeman and Donald got tangled up after Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan threw an interception early in the third quarter in altercation that briefly cleared both sidelines and resulted in Freeman’s disqualification before things settled down.

It’s unclear exactly why Freeman, who stands at 5-foot-8 and 206 pounds, took exception to Donald in the aftermath of the play. But after the ball caromed off the hands of receiver Mohamed Sanu and was snagged off the shoestrings by linebacker Cory Littleton, Freeman directly engaged Donald by putting both hands on his facemask.

Donald responded by literally lifting Freeman off the ground by his shoulder pads, and when Freeman cocked his fist back to throw the punch, he didn’t have much leverage to connect.

The referee quickly got in the middle of the fracas before Freeman could do any more damage — more likely to himself than Donald — while both teams engaged each other on the field.

As Freeman left the field, Donald was seen visibly laughing on the Rams’ bench as they led 21-3.
description: Falcons running back Devonta Freeman took out his frustrations on Rams defensive tackle Aaron Donald on Sunday and was subsequently ejected.
